00047 static int osc_active_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00048 {
00049         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00050 
00051         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(dev);
00052         seq_printf(m, "%d\n", !dev->u.cli.cl_import->imp_deactive);
00053         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(dev);
00054         return 0;
00055 }
00056 
00057 static ssize_t osc_active_seq_write(struct file *file,
00058                                     const char __user *buffer,
00059                                     size_t count, loff_t *off)
00060 {
00061         struct obd_device *dev = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00062         int rc;
00063         __s64 val;
00064 
00065         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00066         if (rc)
00067                 return rc;
00068         if (val < 0 || val > 1)
00069                 return -ERANGE;
00070 
00071         /* opposite senses */
00072         if (dev->u.cli.cl_import->imp_deactive == val)
00073                 rc = ptlrpc_set_import_active(dev->u.cli.cl_import, val);
00074         else
00075                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "activate %d: ignoring repeat request\n",
00076                         (int)val);
00077 
00078         return count;
00079 }
00080 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_active);

00082 static int osc_max_rpcs_in_flight_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00083 {
00084         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00085         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00086 
00087         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00088         seq_printf(m, "%u\n", cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight);
00089         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00090         return 0;
00091 }
00092 
00093 static ssize_t osc_max_rpcs_in_flight_seq_write(struct file *file,
00094                                                 const char __user *buffer,
00095                                                 size_t count, loff_t *off)
00096 {
00097         struct obd_device *dev = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00098         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00099         int rc;
00100         int adding, added, req_count;
00101         __s64 val;
00102 
00103         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00104         if (rc)
00105                 return rc;
00106         if (val < 1 || val > OSC_MAX_RIF_MAX)
00107                 return -ERANGE;
00108 
00109         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(dev);
00110 
00111         adding = (int)val - cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight;
00112         req_count = atomic_read(&osc_pool_req_count);
00113         if (adding > 0 && req_count < osc_reqpool_maxreqcount) {
00114                 /*
00115                  * There might be some race which will cause over-limit
00116                  * allocation, but it is fine.
00117                  */
00118                 if (req_count + adding > osc_reqpool_maxreqcount)
00119                         adding = osc_reqpool_maxreqcount - req_count;
00120 
00121                 added = osc_rq_pool->prp_populate(osc_rq_pool, adding);
00122                 atomic_add(added, &osc_pool_req_count);
00123         }
00124 
00125         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00126         cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight = val;
00127         client_adjust_max_dirty(cli);
00128         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00129 
00130         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(dev);
00131         return count;
00132 }
00133 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_max_rpcs_in_flight);
00134 
00135 static int osc_max_dirty_mb_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00136 {
00137         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00138         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00139         long val;
00140         int mult;
00141 
00142         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00143         val = cli->cl_dirty_max_pages;
00144         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00145 
00146         mult = 1 << (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00147         return lprocfs_seq_read_frac_helper(m, val, mult);
00148 }
00149 
00150 static ssize_t osc_max_dirty_mb_seq_write(struct file *file,
00151                                           const char __user *buffer,
00152                                           size_t count, loff_t *off)
00153 {
00154         struct obd_device *dev = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00155         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00156         int rc;
00157         __s64 pages_number;
00158 
00159         rc = lprocfs_str_with_units_to_s64(buffer, count, &pages_number, 'M');
00160         if (rc)
00161                 return rc;
00162 
00163         pages_number >>= PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00164 
00165         if (pages_number <= 0 ||
00166             pages_number >= OSC_MAX_DIRTY_MB_MAX << (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) ||
00167             pages_number > totalram_pages / 4) /* 1/4 of RAM */
00168                 return -ERANGE;
00169 
00170         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00171         cli->cl_dirty_max_pages = pages_number;
00172         osc_wake_cache_waiters(cli);
00173         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00174 
00175         return count;
00176 }
00177 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_max_dirty_mb);
00178 
00179 static int osc_cached_mb_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00180 {
00181         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00182         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00183         int shift = 20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00184 
00185         seq_printf(m, "used_mb: %ld\n"
00186                    "busy_cnt: %ld\n"
00187                    "reclaim: "LPU64"\n",
00188                    (atomic_long_read(&cli->cl_lru_in_list) +
00189                     atomic_long_read(&cli->cl_lru_busy)) >> shift,
00190                     atomic_long_read(&cli->cl_lru_busy),
00191                    cli->cl_lru_reclaim);
00192 
00193         return 0;
00194 }
00195 
00196 /* shrink the number of caching pages to a specific number */
00197 static ssize_t
00198 osc_cached_mb_seq_write(struct file *file, const char __user *buffer,
00199                         size_t count, loff_t *off)
00200 {
00201         struct obd_device *dev = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00202         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00203         __s64 pages_number;
00204         long rc;
00205         char kernbuf[128];
00206 
00207         if (count >= sizeof(kernbuf))
00208                 return -EINVAL;
00209 
00210         if (copy_from_user(kernbuf, buffer, count))
00211                 return -EFAULT;
00212         kernbuf[count] = 0;
00213 
00214         buffer += lprocfs_find_named_value(kernbuf, "used_mb:", &count) -
00215                   kernbuf;
00216         rc = lprocfs_str_with_units_to_s64(buffer, count, &pages_number, 'M');
00217         if (rc)
00218                 return rc;
00219 
00220         pages_number >>= PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00221 
00222         if (pages_number < 0)
00223                 return -ERANGE;
00224 
00225         rc = atomic_long_read(&cli->cl_lru_in_list) - pages_number;
00226         if (rc > 0) {
00227                 struct lu_env *env;
00228                 __u16 refcheck;
00229 
00230                 env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
00231                 if (!IS_ERR(env)) {
00232                         (void)osc_lru_shrink(env, cli, rc, true);
00233                         cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00234                 }
00235         }
00236 
00237         return count;
00238 }
00239 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_cached_mb);
00240 
00241 static int osc_cur_dirty_bytes_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00242 {
00243         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00244         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00245 
00246         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00247         seq_printf(m, "%lu\n", cli->cl_dirty_pages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00248         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00249         return 0;
00250 }
00251 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(osc_cur_dirty_bytes);

00253 static int osc_cur_grant_bytes_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00254 {
00255         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00256         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00257 
00258         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00259         seq_printf(m, "%lu\n", cli->cl_avail_grant);
00260         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00261         return 0;
00262 }
00263 
00264 static ssize_t osc_cur_grant_bytes_seq_write(struct file *file,
00265                                              const char __user *buffer,
00266                                              size_t count, loff_t *off)
00267 {
00268         struct obd_device *obd = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00269         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
00270         int                rc;
00271         __s64              val;
00272 
00273         if (obd == NULL)
00274                 return 0;
00275 
00276         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00277         if (rc)
00278                 return rc;
00279         if (val < 0)
00280                 return -ERANGE;
00281 
00282         /* this is only for shrinking grant */
00283         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00284         if (val >= cli->cl_avail_grant) {
00285                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00286                 return 0;
00287         }
00288 
00289         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00290 
00291         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(obd);
00292         if (cli->cl_import->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL)
00293                 rc = osc_shrink_grant_to_target(cli, val);
00294         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(obd);
00295         if (rc)
00296                 return rc;
00297         return count;
00298 }
00299 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_cur_grant_bytes);

00336 static ssize_t osc_grant_shrink_interval_seq_write(struct file *file,
00337                                                    const char __user *buffer,
00338                                                    size_t count, loff_t *off)
00339 {
00340         struct obd_device *obd = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00341         int rc;
00342         __s64 val;
00343 
00344         if (obd == NULL)
00345                 return 0;
00346 
00347         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00348         if (rc)
00349                 return rc;
00350 
00351         if (val <= 0 || val > INT_MAX)
00352                 return -ERANGE;
00353 
00354         obd->u.cli.cl_grant_shrink_interval = val;
00355 
00356         return count;
00357 }

00360 static int osc_checksum_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)

00363 
00364         if (obd == NULL)
00365                 return 0;

00371 static ssize_t osc_checksum_seq_write(struct file *file,
00372                                       const char __user *buffer,
00373                                       size_t count, loff_t *off)
00374 {
00375         struct obd_device *obd = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00376         int rc;
00377         __s64 val;
00378 
00379         if (obd == NULL)
00380                 return 0;
00381 
00382         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00383         if (rc)
00384                 return rc;
00385 
00386         obd->u.cli.cl_checksum = !!val;
00387 
00388         return count;
00389 }
00390 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_checksum);

00392 static int osc_checksum_type_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00393 {
00394         struct obd_device *obd = m->private;
00395         int i;
00396         DECLARE_CKSUM_NAME;
00397 
00398         if (obd == NULL)
00399                 return 0;
00400 
00401         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(cksum_name); i++) {
00402                 if (((1 << i) & obd->u.cli.cl_supp_cksum_types) == 0)
00403                         continue;
00404                 if (obd->u.cli.cl_cksum_type == (1 << i))
00405                         seq_printf(m, "[%s] ", cksum_name[i]);
00406                 else
00407                         seq_printf(m, "%s ", cksum_name[i]);
00408         }
00409         seq_printf(m, "\n");
00410         return 0;
00411 }
00412 
00413 static ssize_t osc_checksum_type_seq_write(struct file *file,
00414                                            const char __user *buffer,
00415                                            size_t count, loff_t *off)
00416 {
00417         struct obd_device *obd = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00418         int i;
00419         DECLARE_CKSUM_NAME;
00420         char kernbuf[10];
00421 
00422         if (obd == NULL)
00423                 return 0;
00424 
00425         if (count > sizeof(kernbuf) - 1)
00426                 return -EINVAL;
00427         if (copy_from_user(kernbuf, buffer, count))
00428                 return -EFAULT;
00429         if (count > 0 && kernbuf[count - 1] == '\n')
00430                 kernbuf[count - 1] = '\0';
00431         else
00432                 kernbuf[count] = '\0';
00433 
00434         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(cksum_name); i++) {
00435                 if (((1 << i) & obd->u.cli.cl_supp_cksum_types) == 0)
00436                         continue;
00437                 if (!strcmp(kernbuf, cksum_name[i])) {
00438                        obd->u.cli.cl_cksum_type = 1 << i;
00439                        return count;
00440                 }
00441         }
00442         return -EINVAL;
00443 }
00444 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_checksum_type);

00454 static ssize_t osc_resend_count_seq_write(struct file *file,
00455                                           const char __user *buffer,
00456                                           size_t count, loff_t *off)
00457 {
00458         struct obd_device *obd = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00459         int rc;
00460         __s64 val;
00461 
00462         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00463         if (rc)
00464                 return rc;
00465 
00466         if (val < 0 || val > INT_MAX)
00467                 return -EINVAL;
00468 
00469         atomic_set(&obd->u.cli.cl_resends, val);
00470 
00471         return count;
00472 }
00473 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_resend_count);

00544 static int osc_obd_max_pages_per_rpc_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00545 {
00546         return lprocfs_obd_max_pages_per_rpc_seq_show(m, m->private);
00547 }
00548 
00549 static ssize_t osc_obd_max_pages_per_rpc_seq_write(struct file *file,
00550                                                    const char __user *buffer,
00551                                                    size_t count, loff_t *off)
00552 {
00553         struct obd_device *dev = ((struct seq_file *)file->private_data)->private;
00554         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00555         struct obd_connect_data *ocd = &cli->cl_import->imp_connect_data;
00556         int chunk_mask, rc;
00557         __s64 val;
00558 
00559         rc = lprocfs_str_to_s64(buffer, count, &val);
00560         if (rc)
00561                 return rc;
00562         if (val < 0)
00563                 return -ERANGE;
00564 
00565         /* if the max_pages is specified in bytes, convert to pages */
00566         if (val >= ONE_MB_BRW_SIZE)
00567                 val >>= PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00568 
00569         LPROCFS_CLIMP_CHECK(dev);
00570 
00571         chunk_mask = ~((1 << (cli->cl_chunkbits - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT)) - 1);
00572         /* max_pages_per_rpc must be chunk aligned */
00573         val = (val + ~chunk_mask) & chunk_mask;
00574         if (val == 0 || (ocd->ocd_brw_size != 0 &&
00575                          val > ocd->ocd_brw_size >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT)) {
00576                 LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(dev);
00577                 return -ERANGE;
00578         }
00579         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00580         cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc = val;
00581         client_adjust_max_dirty(cli);
00582         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00583 
00584         LPROCFS_CLIMP_EXIT(dev);
00585         return count;
00586 }
00587 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_obd_max_pages_per_rpc);
00588 
00589 static int osc_unstable_stats_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00590 {
00591         struct obd_device *dev = m->private;
00592         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00593         long pages;
00594         int mb;
00595 
00596         pages = atomic_long_read(&cli->cl_unstable_count);
00597         mb    = (pages * PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) >> 20;
00598 
00599         seq_printf(m, "unstable_pages: %20ld\n"
00600                    "unstable_mb:              %10d\n",
00601                    pages, mb);
00602         return 0;
00603 }
00604 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO(osc_unstable_stats);
00605

00692 
00693 #define pct(a,b) (b ? a * 100 / b : 0)
00694 
00695 static int osc_rpc_stats_seq_show(struct seq_file *seq, void *v)
00696 {
00697         struct timeval now;
00698         struct obd_device *dev = seq->private;
00699         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00700         unsigned long read_tot = 0, write_tot = 0, read_cum, write_cum;
00701         int i;
00702 
00703         do_gettimeofday(&now);
00704 
00705         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00706 
00707         seq_printf(seq, "snapshot_time:         %lu.%lu (secs.usecs)\n",
00708                    now.tv_sec, now.tv_usec);
00709         seq_printf(seq, "read RPCs in flight:  %d\n",
00710                    cli->cl_r_in_flight);
00711         seq_printf(seq, "write RPCs in flight: %d\n",
00712                    cli->cl_w_in_flight);
00713         seq_printf(seq, "pending write pages:  %d\n",
00714                    atomic_read(&cli->cl_pending_w_pages));
00715         seq_printf(seq, "pending read pages:   %d\n",
00716                    atomic_read(&cli->cl_pending_r_pages));
00717 
00718         seq_printf(seq, "\n\t\t\tread\t\t\twrite\n");
00719         seq_printf(seq, "pages per rpc         rpcs   %% cum %% |");
00720         seq_printf(seq, "       rpcs   %% cum %%\n");
00721 
00722         read_tot = lprocfs_oh_sum(&cli->cl_read_page_hist);
00723         write_tot = lprocfs_oh_sum(&cli->cl_write_page_hist);
00724 
00725         read_cum = 0;
00726         write_cum = 0;
00727         for (i = 0; i < OBD_HIST_MAX; i++) {
00728                 unsigned long r = cli->cl_read_page_hist.oh_buckets[i];
00729                 unsigned long w = cli->cl_write_page_hist.oh_buckets[i];
00730 
00731                 read_cum += r;
00732                 write_cum += w;
00733                 seq_printf(seq, "%d:\t\t%10lu %3lu %3lu   | %10lu %3lu %3lu\n",
00734                            1 << i, r, pct(r, read_tot),
00735                            pct(read_cum, read_tot), w,
00736                            pct(w, write_tot),
00737                            pct(write_cum, write_tot));
00738                 if (read_cum == read_tot && write_cum == write_tot)
00739                         break;
00740         }
00741 
00742         seq_printf(seq, "\n\t\t\tread\t\t\twrite\n");
00743         seq_printf(seq, "rpcs in flight        rpcs   %% cum %% |");
00744         seq_printf(seq, "       rpcs   %% cum %%\n");
00745 
00746         read_tot = lprocfs_oh_sum(&cli->cl_read_rpc_hist);
00747         write_tot = lprocfs_oh_sum(&cli->cl_write_rpc_hist);
00748 
00749         read_cum = 0;
00750         write_cum = 0;
00751         for (i = 0; i < OBD_HIST_MAX; i++) {
00752                 unsigned long r = cli->cl_read_rpc_hist.oh_buckets[i];
00753                 unsigned long w = cli->cl_write_rpc_hist.oh_buckets[i];
00754                 read_cum += r;
00755                 write_cum += w;
00756                 seq_printf(seq, "%d:\t\t%10lu %3lu %3lu   | %10lu %3lu %3lu\n",
00757                            i, r, pct(r, read_tot),
00758                            pct(read_cum, read_tot), w,
00759                            pct(w, write_tot),
00760                            pct(write_cum, write_tot));
00761                 if (read_cum == read_tot && write_cum == write_tot)
00762                         break;
00763         }
00764 
00765         seq_printf(seq, "\n\t\t\tread\t\t\twrite\n");
00766         seq_printf(seq, "offset                rpcs   %% cum %% |");
00767         seq_printf(seq, "       rpcs   %% cum %%\n");
00768 
00769         read_tot = lprocfs_oh_sum(&cli->cl_read_offset_hist);
00770         write_tot = lprocfs_oh_sum(&cli->cl_write_offset_hist);
00771 
00772         read_cum = 0;
00773         write_cum = 0;
00774         for (i = 0; i < OBD_HIST_MAX; i++) {
00775                 unsigned long r = cli->cl_read_offset_hist.oh_buckets[i];
00776                 unsigned long w = cli->cl_write_offset_hist.oh_buckets[i];
00777                 read_cum += r;
00778                 write_cum += w;
00779                 seq_printf(seq, "%d:\t\t%10lu %3lu %3lu   | %10lu %3lu %3lu\n",
00780                            (i == 0) ? 0 : 1 << (i - 1),
00781                            r, pct(r, read_tot), pct(read_cum, read_tot),
00782                            w, pct(w, write_tot), pct(write_cum, write_tot));
00783                 if (read_cum == read_tot && write_cum == write_tot)
00784                         break;
00785         }
00786 
00787         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00788 
00789         return 0;
00790 }
00791 #undef pct
00792 
00793 static ssize_t osc_rpc_stats_seq_write(struct file *file,
00794                                        const char __user *buf,
00795                                        size_t len, loff_t *off)
00796 {
00797         struct seq_file *seq = file->private_data;
00798         struct obd_device *dev = seq->private;
00799         struct client_obd *cli = &dev->u.cli;
00800 
00801         lprocfs_oh_clear(&cli->cl_read_rpc_hist);
00802         lprocfs_oh_clear(&cli->cl_write_rpc_hist);
00803         lprocfs_oh_clear(&cli->cl_read_page_hist);
00804         lprocfs_oh_clear(&cli->cl_write_page_hist);
00805         lprocfs_oh_clear(&cli->cl_read_offset_hist);
00806         lprocfs_oh_clear(&cli->cl_write_offset_hist);
00807 
00808         return len;
00809 }
00810 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_rpc_stats);
00811 
00812 static int osc_stats_seq_show(struct seq_file *seq, void *v)
00813 {
00814         struct timeval now;
00815         struct obd_device *dev = seq->private;
00816         struct osc_stats *stats = &obd2osc_dev(dev)->od_stats;
00817 
00818         do_gettimeofday(&now);
00819 
00820         seq_printf(seq, "snapshot_time:         %lu.%lu (secs.usecs)\n",
00821                    now.tv_sec, now.tv_usec);
00822         seq_printf(seq, "lockless_write_bytes\t\t"LPU64"\n",
00823                    stats->os_lockless_writes);
00824         seq_printf(seq, "lockless_read_bytes\t\t"LPU64"\n",
00825                    stats->os_lockless_reads);
00826         seq_printf(seq, "lockless_truncate\t\t"LPU64"\n",
00827                    stats->os_lockless_truncates);
00828         return 0;
00829 }
00830 
00831 static ssize_t osc_stats_seq_write(struct file *file,
00832                                    const char __user *buf,
00833                                    size_t len, loff_t *off)
00834 {
00835         struct seq_file *seq = file->private_data;
00836         struct obd_device *dev = seq->private;
00837         struct osc_stats *stats = &obd2osc_dev(dev)->od_stats;
00838 
00839         memset(stats, 0, sizeof(*stats));
00840         return len;
00841 }
00842 
00843 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS(osc_stats);
00844 
00845 int lproc_osc_attach_seqstat(struct obd_device *dev)
00846 {
00847         int rc;
00848 
00849         rc = lprocfs_seq_create(dev->obd_proc_entry, "osc_stats", 0644,
00850                                 &osc_stats_fops, dev);
00851         if (rc == 0)
00852                 rc = lprocfs_obd_seq_create(dev, "rpc_stats", 0644,
00853                                             &osc_rpc_stats_fops, dev);
00854 
00855         return rc;
00856 }
